page.title: 09CLARE AT HORNSEA PRIMARY
page.content: I wake up at about half past seven but read for ten more minutes then wash in cold water. I put on my uniform and get my things ready. Then my mother makes the breakfast. I have cereal and toast. I leave for school at half past eight. When the whistle blows we rush in and hang up our coats. We have Maths and English during the morning and sometimes Country Dancing. We wait for three whistles to tell us it is dinnertime. We are always on last sitting. It might be stew and jelly. Sometimes I go to recorder lessons. We play games like rounders and netball in the afternoon. I walk home through the park with Emma and we go to tennis practice at the Secondary School. Then I go to Emma's for tea. Clare Palmer
